Here&#x27;s how to threat hunt for a common persistence method used by attackers including DragonForce.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/threat-hunting-case-study-medusa-ransomware"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="medusalisting.jpeg" aria-label="Threat hunting case study: Medusa ransomware" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; Here&#x27;s how to threat hunt for a User Account Control bypass, one of the tactics, techniques and procedures this group and its affiliates use.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/understanding-and-threat-hunting-for-rmm-software-misuse"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="listingrmmabuse.jpeg" aria-label="Understanding and threat hunting for RMM software misuse" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; Here&#x27;s a briefing on RMM platform misuse and guidance for how to threat hunt for misbehavior.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/threat-hunting-case-study-windows-management-instrumentation-abuse"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="listingwmic.jpeg" aria-label="Threat-hunting case study: Windows Management Instrumentation abuse" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; This case study describes how to threat hunt for malicious use of WMI, which is also used legitimately by administrators.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/six-key-takeaways-from-the-sans-2025-threat-hunting-survey"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="Intel-471-SANS-Survey.png" aria-label="Six Key Takeaways From the SANS 2025 Threat Hunting Survey" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; This activity, however, can be detected using threat hunts based on threat  intelligence.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/threat-hunting-case-study-socgholish"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="socgholishinfected_2025-02-14-031929_jqvr.jpeg" aria-label="Threat hunting case study: SocGholish" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; This is a guide for how to detect infections by searching in SIEMs and logging systems for attacker behaviors.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/threat-hunting-case-study-psexec"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="PsExec-listing.jpeg" aria-label="Threat hunting case study: PsExec" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27; Here&#x27;s how to threat hunt for suspicious PsExec activity.</p></div></article></a><a class="group block" href="/blog/bring-your-own-hunts-to-hunter"><article class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-start gap-4 sm:gap-6"><div class="w-full sm:flex-shrink-0 sm:w-[200px] lg:w-[285px]"><div class="w-full overflow-hidden aspect-[16/9]"><div class="relative w-full overflow-hidden bg-gray-100" style="aspect-ratio:570/410"><img alt="BYOH-Blog-Intel-471.jpeg" aria-label="Bring Your Own Hunts to HUNTER" loading="lazy" width="855" height="615" decoding="async" data-nimg="1" class="w-full group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300 ease-in-out" style="color:transparent;background-size:cover;background-position:50% 50%;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-image:url(&quot;data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg xmlns=&#x27;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&#x27;
